Class TableView

java.lang.Object
view.TableView
public class TableView extends Object
Table view component - handles table display and pagination. Uses TableFormatter to format table data.

    Default constructor for TableView.

  • Method Details

    • displayPaginatedTable

      public static boolean displayPaginatedTable(List<?> items, String header, String emptyMsg, Function<Integer,String> detailGetter, BiFunction<Object,Integer,String[]> rowFormatter, Function<Object,Integer> getID, String[] tableHeaders, FilterSettings filterSettings, Consumer<Integer> onAction, String actionPrompt, Map<String, Consumer<Integer>> actions, Map<String,String> actionPrompts, Scanner sc, String border, int width)
      Displays a paginated table with headers, navigation, and interactive actions. Supports detail viewing, filtering, and custom actions on table items. Main method with all parameters - other overloads delegate to this.
      Parameters:
      items - List of items to display in the table
      header - Table header title
      emptyMsg - Message to display when list is empty
      detailGetter - Function to retrieve detailed view by ID
      rowFormatter - Function to format each row: (item, displayNumber) -> String[]
      getID - Function to extract ID from item object
      tableHeaders - Array of column header labels
      filterSettings - Current filter settings (null if filtering not supported)
      onAction - Single action callback (deprecated - use actions map instead)
      actionPrompt - Single action prompt (deprecated - use actionPrompts map instead)
      actions - Map of action codes to callbacks (e.g., "A" -> approve, "W" -> withdraw)
      actionPrompts - Map of action codes to display prompts (e.g., "A" -> "approve")
      sc - Scanner for reading user input
      border - Border string for visual separation
      width - Display width for formatting
      Returns:
      true if filter menu requested, false to exit table view

    • displayPreviewTable

      public static void displayPreviewTable(List<?> items, String header, String emptyMsg, BiFunction<Object,Integer,String[]> rowFormatter, String[] tableHeaders, int maxPreviewItems)
      Display simple table preview (first N items) - uses small header for filters.
      Parameters:
      items - list of items to display
      header - table header text
      emptyMsg - message to show when no results
      rowFormatter - function to format each row
      tableHeaders - table column headers
      maxPreviewItems - maximum number of items to show
